original: Armstedt, Curt Henry, disponent, Göteborg, f. 29/11/91 i Lysekil av sjö-kapt. Carl Hilmer Andersson o. Anette Olsson. G. 17 m. Elsa Olsson. Barn: Inger-Anette f. 20, Hellen 22. — Genomg. Gbgs priv. hand:inst. Tj :-man v. A-B Sv:es Fören. Konserv-fabr. i Gbg fr. 07, disp. där is ed. 22. Ordf. i Nord. roddförb., i Sv. roddförb. sed, 34, i de milit. kamratfören. arb :-utsk. i Gbg, arrangör av 25 :e nord. landskampen i rodd i Sthlm 39, v. ordf. i Livhus. kamratfören. i Gbg, led. av hand:- o. sjöfartsndn i Gbg, led. av tax:nd, av Anmedals förs. kyrkoråd, v. ordf. i styr. f. gatu- o. vägförvaltn. i Gbg, fd. v. ordf. i Gbgs stads avlön:-nd, magistratsbesiktn :man i Gbg, komp :chef i Gbgs hemvärn o. landst., fd. rev. i drätselkamm. o. sjukh:di-rekt. i Gbg, stämmoomb. v. Sv. arb :-giv:fören. allm. grupp i Sthlm, v. ordf. i folkpart. i Gbg o. Annedals förs. diakoni. RVO, ProPatrstGM, 6 GM, FMM, TyskOlHt.
translated: Armstedt, Curt Henry, manager, Gothenburg, born November 29, 1891 in Lysekil to sea captain Carl Hilmer Andersson and Anette Olsson. Married to Elsa Olsson for 17 years. Children: Inger-Anette born in 1920, Hellen in 1922. He attended a private business school in Gothenburg and worked as a clerk for A-B Sweden's Canning Factory from 1907 to 1922, when he became manager. He served as chairman of the Nordic Rowing Association, the Swedish Rowing Association since 1934, worked on the military comradeship in Gothenburg, organized the 25th Nordic Rowing Championships in Stockholm in 1939, was vice-chairman of the Livhuset Comradeship in Gothenburg, was a member of the Gothenburg Commerce and Shipping Committee, a member of the tax committee, a member of the board of directors at the Anmedal Church, vice-chairman of the board of directors for road management in Gothenburg, former vice-chairman of the Gothenburg City Salary Committee and a magistrate inspector in Gothenburg. He was also the commander of the Gothenburg Home Guard and County, former auditor of the Treasury Committee and former director of the hospital in Gothenburg. He was a member of the general group of the Swedish Employer's Association in Stockholm, vice-chairman of the People's Party in Gothenburg and the Annedal Parish Diaconate. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa, the Pro Patria Grand Master Cross, six gold medals, the Swedish Women's Voluntary Defence Service Medal and the German Olympic Games Medal.
